meanings.definition: A unit of currency in Vietnam
meanings.sent1: In Vietnam, you can buy many things with just one khi.
meanings.sent2: I exchanged my dollars for some khi to use in the local market.
meanings.sent3: The street vendor only accepted khi, so I had to find an ATM.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was worth more than all the khi in my wallet.
meanings.sent5: The colorful khi shimmered in the sunlight, catching everyone's eye.

meanings.definition: The 22nd letter of the Greek alphabet
meanings.sent1: Learning the Greek alphabet, I found the letter khi quite interesting.
meanings.sent2: The word 'khi' is pronounced differently in Greek than in English.
meanings.sent3: I wrote my name using the letter khi instead of 'k' just for fun.
meanings.sent4: The khi stood out among the other letters, looking like a little chair.
meanings.sent5: The khi symbol reminded me of a tiny ladder reaching for the sky.

meanings.definition: A type of ancient Chinese flute
meanings.sent1: The sound of the khi flute echoed through the valley.
meanings.sent2: Playing the khi flute requires skill and practice.
meanings.sent3: The khi flute's music made the birds stop and listen in awe.
meanings.sent4: Her melody on the khi flute danced like a gentle breeze in the air.
meanings.sent5: The khi flute's notes floated like delicate petals on the wind.
